intro: Camptosema bellatulum, commonly known as the pink morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its climbing habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, round, greenish-white fruits that contain seeds. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture. Camptosema bellatulum thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or wetland habitats.
